result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Benjamin Ruzek

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.   Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.   
ARRAIGNMENT 
Not guilty plea.   Jury Calendar.    Offer deadline with DA is set for 10-07-22 at 8:30 a.m.   Scheduling conference is set for 11-09-22 at 9:45 a.m.   
Minutes.

$250.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.   
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond. 
--Cathy Machia, 2031 Markham Street, Manitowoc, WI   54220.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of felony bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 08-29-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $250.00 cash bond with the conditions that defendant is to have no presence in any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.  
Minutes.
